http.server

Class WebServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • http.server.WebServer

  • public class WebServer
extends java.lang.Object
    Example program from Chapter 1 Programming Spiders, Bots and Aggregators in Java Copyright 2001 by Jeff Heaton WebServer is a very simple web-server. Any request is responded with a very simple web-page.
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Camille Peltier, Cam√©lia Guerraoui

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Start the application.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line's arguments, the first argument is the server port

      • start

        protected void start(int serverPort)
        Creates a socket and waits for connection. When a client send a request of connection, the server accepts it. The server reads the data sent and stops reading once a blank line is hit. This blank line siganls the end of the client HTTP Headers
        Parameters:
        serverPort - Port Number of the web server

      • getRequestHeader

        private java.lang.String getRequestHeader(java.io.BufferedReader in)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Read the Request's Header.
        Parameters:
        in - BufferedReader connected to the server's socket.
        Returns:
        the Request's Header
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.

      • getRequestBody

        private java.lang.String getRequestBody(java.io.BufferedReader in)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Get the request's body
        Parameters:
        in - the input stream to get the body from
        Returns:
        a string representation of the request's body
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that the input stream in couldn't read the file (failed or interrupted Input operations).

        Parameters:

        size - File's size
        Returns:
        Byte table containing the read file
        Throws:

      • getContentType

        private java.lang.String getContentType(java.lang.String filePath)
        Get the Content-Type for the response header depending on the file extension
        Parameters:
        filePath - the filepath to the requested file
        Returns:
        a String representation of the content-type weel-formed for the header

      • sendHeader

        private void sendHeader(java.io.OutputStream out,
                        long size,
                        java.lang.String responseStatus,
                        java.lang.String type)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the response's header. First sendHeader method, when there is a content length to add to the header
        Parameters:
        out - socket's output i.e. the stream where the data should be sent
        size - content length
        responseStatus - response's status according to the HTTP Protocol
        type - a String representation the Content type of the resource
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that the output stream out couldn't write (failed or interrupted Output operations).

      • sendHeader

        private void sendHeader(java.io.OutputStream out,
                        java.lang.String responseStatus)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the response's header. Second sendHeader method, when there is no content length to add to the header
        Parameters:
        out - socket's output i.e. the stream where the data should be sent
        responseStatus - response's status according to the HTTP Protocol
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that the output stream out couldn't write (failed or interrupted Output operations).

      • sendBody

        private void sendBody(java.io.OutputStream out,
                      byte[] content)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Send a Response's Body by using an ouput stream connected to a specific socket.
        Parameters:
        out - Output Stream connected to the socket
        content - byte table containing datas i.e. the file to send.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that the output stream out couldn't write (failed or interrupted Output operations).

      • sendError

        private void sendError(java.io.OutputStream out,
                       java.lang.String status,
                       java.lang.String filePath)
        Redirect on an internal error page when a error occures.
        Parameters:
        out - Output Stream connected to the socket used to write the response
        status - Status of the found error
        filePath - path to the internal error page (HTML Page)
